Name: Ragunna Sales Blitz IV
Description: Alannah seems to be interested in Lollo Logistics vehicles
QuestDesc: Alannah seems to be interested in Lollo Logistics vehicles

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, do you like cars? Or automobiles in general?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, but I can't afford one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do, too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on, nothing beats the sound of the engine roaring as you zoom down the open road with the wind in your hair. It's a feeling you don't get to enjoy anywhere else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should give it a try when you get the chance. You'll love it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Same here. But, yeah, they aren't cheap to get. Hahaha.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I digress. During my time in Ragunna, I noticed their road infrastructure isn't the finest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You won't find many roads in the countryside, and even the city roads aren't friendly for driving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why don't we explore the market for scale model cars in Ragunna? We might discover some potential automobile enthusiasts there.

Options.PlotLineKey: If there's no demand, we'll create one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about we go to Lollo Logistics for some pointers? They use a variety of vehicles, which can help us figure out what's best for making models!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, now what...

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What seems to be the trouble?

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I finished loading all my cargo and was getting ready to leave, but the darn engine wouldn't start for some reason...

Options.PlotLineKey: Let me give it a look.
You know, I'm something of an auto mechanic myself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's some quick fixing! Whew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was awesome, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Troubled Courier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fantastic, for a while there I thought I was gonna miss my delivery. I can't thank you enough. Time for me to hit the road. See you both around!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The courier starts the engine. You watch as the vehicle slowly disappears into the distance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never know you are an auto repair expert, {PlayerName}! So you know every nut and bolt inside that truck?

Options.PlotLineKey: Like the back of my hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then it'll make our model-making job a cakewalk. So, without further ado, let's get to work!

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drum roll, please. It's that time again. Let's see how our truck model was received over at Ragunna...

Dialogues.Speaker: Survey Feedback
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "And the 'Ugly Car Award' goes to..." "Did someone get tired of the Cloudpuffers? Or are Tubpups not cute enough?" "Who would ride in crappy metal containers when we have Gondolas around?"...

Options.PlotLineKey: Probably not many car people over there.
So they don't really need cars.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I get it now. You can't expect to open a shoe store and make sales when the locals are running around barefoot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They've got cute-looking Echoes that can be used for transportation. There's no reason for them to have cars.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* Getting that three-million-copy sale feels nothing more than a pipe dream now.

Options.PlotLineKey: It was an impossible sale to begin with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so nice, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Alannah
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gotta do my research and learn more about their actual preferences. I can't be just making up a market willy-nilly...
